ygData.subject: Re: Twinking
ygData.msgSnippet: Hmmm... maybe I ll try to beat Kharlisht s post length!! haha. To Twink or not to Twink, that is the question. Here s something to ponder... most people who
ygData.messageBody:
Hmmm... maybe I'll try to beat Kharlisht's post
length!! haha. To Twink or not to Twink, that is the
question. Here's something to ponder... most people who are
avid RPG players abor twinking when they first start
this game and are not "rich" enough to do any twinking
anyway (though there are some who think "WOW-- i can't
wait 'till i can twink a new char.!!!"). Then comes
the dillemma-- you now have spen a lot of time in
Norrath and have at least one char of such a level that
he/she has a sizable account in the bank and backpacks
full of items that are great, but you'll never use.
What to do??<br><br>Are you any less of a player
because you twink? I used to think so, but maybe i'm
changing my mind. Maybe some people just see that as
another way to have fun with the game, and after all...
it's just a game. Personally-- I think my low level
chars are twinked even though they have cloth armor and
a bronze dagger. My lower chars are twinked because
of my knowledge and experience playing this game. I
know about quests, mobs, zones and fighting strategies
(though class specific strategies, especially with my new
chanter, still show my how much of a n00b I really am!!!).
I know when to flee to avoid certain death, how to
help my fellow groupmates best, and -hehe- which way
to turn to send that orc Lego on a path away from me
so I can make it to the zone. <br><br>As for being
invincable by twinking-- i think that depends on what class
you are. Casters can get more mana by twinking, but
can't get better spells, so they are limited when it
comes to taking on Red mobs even if twinked. Also, even
if you twink caster armor, they still have low HP
and AC, and are going to get crushed by mobs. Case in
point-- i grouped with a twinked lvl 10 wizzie in CB, who
had TONS of mana and kept unloading lvl 8 nukes on
Legos-- also kept getting agrod and dying because 5 hits
and she was dead. (which is pretty good, because as
an un-twinked chanter, 2-3 hits usually kills
me!!)<br><br>Melee classes seem to be best suited for twinking, at
least to be sucessful at lower levels. <br><br>Last
point-- acceptable/unacceptable twinking is such a grey
area. There is an economy in Norrath, and everything
can be for sale. Low levels can find way to "twink"
their own money supply, buy selling bone chips/bat
wings-- starting trades (I know a low teen mage who
twinked himself after getting to the point of tailoring
those backpacks), etc. Personally, I play for fun and
it's not fun to me if there is not challenge or risk.
I CAN NOT count how many times my main char has
died-- if he was twinked from the start, that number
would probably be 1/2 and i'd be 5 levels higher than I
am right now at least. But I've been killed by some
of the greatest mobs in Norrath, and am proud of the
many "Xela" notches in the belts of those mobs-- and
even more proud of the notches in my belt when I
return and exact painful revenge!!!<br><br>No
Farming..... that's another topic....
(/grin)<br><br>Xela<br><br>--how'd i do Kharlisht??
